column4: How do I make the booting process more verbose? Removing the "quiet" grub switch is not enough.
isn't there some kind of debug-swith you can use?
I'll look it up.
sudo is for command line.. gksudo is for X software
using sudo for gui software is bad.. very bad
So I should always do "gksudo gedit"?
yes
what's the problem?
what happens if you try to delete it using ... say.. Nautilus? (nautilus=the file manager in gnome)
those are some weird looking folders.. have you checked the drive for errors?
Surfing *without* an IP???
yes.. I guess you could use some kind of proxy and communicate with the proxy using.. perhaps some weird network without ip-numbers... that would be surfing without an ip, right ? =)
I've heard of "IP spoofing" but I don't understand how it's possible on a DSL/cable modem.
where is this download - folder of yours, the one you can't delete?
There are folders (that act weird and cannot be deleted) within Downloads; I'll try to fsck the partition.
I had something like that happen to me once.. was a usb memory and I couldn't delete certain folders.. fsck found errors on the drive, fixed those and then I could delete the folders..
So I umount the ext3 LVM LUKS RAID partition and fsck it?
ouch.. you're using raid and lvm.. never done that... can't really say if that's the way or not.. sorry
timewriter: I found a way to rm the dirs-I just did it on the server. Turns out Ubuntu didn't recognize Cyrillic.
oh? how did you delete it then? command line?
if they are on the desktop they should be fairly safe to delete.. I don't know how happy cedega will be though
